title: Please publish MSBuild 15.9 nuget packages
body: Please publish nuget packages for latest version 15.9.20.

nodes.body: While I chase down someone with permission to publish to nuget.org, they're available in our MyGet feed, for example https://dotnet.myget.org/feed/msbuild/package/nuget/Microsoft.Build/15.9.20.
@leecow can you help us get these msbuild packages out to nuget.org?

We'll need to normalize what this looks like because attempting to manage the process this way is not great. A few things ...

- When did we know that 15.9.20 would need to be published
- What is the precise package list to the published
- Is this a firedrill

> We'll need to normalize what this looks like because attempting to manage the process this way is not great.

Agreed. It's been sufficiently infrequent that we haven't automated it so far, but I'd love for it to be solved forever.

> * When did we know that 15.9.20 would need to be published

Technically, not until VS 15.9 went RTM. Realistically, confidence increased before that as escrow tightened.

> * What is the precise package list to the published

According to our [internal doc](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/toolsforeng/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2Ftoolsforeng%2FOne%20Note%2FToolsForSoftwareEngineers&wd=target%28Build%20Tools%2FMSBuild%2FGitHub.one%7CFF6DC598-65EC-43D5-AB29-DB38FEB82BC8%2FMyGet%20Feed%7CFAFC6258-899D-48D4-8DB4-892396202C9C%2F%29) on this,

```
Microsoft.Build
Microsoft.Build.Conversion.Core
Microsoft.Build.Engine
Microsoft.Build.Framework
Microsoft.Build.Runtime
Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Core
Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Core
```

> * Is this a firedrill

I don't think it's urgent. We shouldn't have done it before VS RTM, and we have the MyGet feed with the same packages as a workaround if anyone needs the packages immediately.
@aka-STInG Please try again. Nuget.org should have them now, for example https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Build.Runtime/15.9.20.
